source: A wandering cleric seeking glory and battle.
An evil mage who has sought an isolated location to perform unspeakable experiments without interference.
A wandering ranger seeking glory and battle.
An experienced bandit, much more skilled than his followers.
Hailing from barbaric lands, berserkers come together in war parties to seek battle.
Spawned by a Defiler, this is a bloodthirsty creature.
Spawned by a Defiler, this is a bloodthirsty creature.
Spawned by a Defiler, this is a bloodthirsty creature.
Part of a cult's leadership, these fanatics use their dogma and charisma to influence and prey on the weak-willed.
A wandering rogue seeking glory and battle.
A very large eagle found in the Marches.
A giant spider fused with a small fire elemental by the weird magical influence of the Badlands.
A winged snake found in the Badlands.
A powerful battle wizard looking for a challenge.
A very experienced and powerful fighter who has gathered followers and won territories.
A more powerful kind of ghoul, known for its terrible stench.
A dead wolf raised by necromantic power.
A ravenous undead creature, constantly searching for flesh to eat.
A giant eagle, corrupted by the magical fluxes of the Badlands.
Very large spiders, they live in the depths of the Badlands and are sensitive to light.
A low-ranking soldier, used to perform mundane security tasks.
A powerful cleric wandering the land to spread his faith with soft words and hard deeds.
A powerful undead creature, preserved for the afterlife.
An evil wizard specializing in necromancy.
Ogres are huge and powerful, but stupid. They live for killing, scavenging, and simple pleasures.
An ogre that has been raised by necromantic power.
Orcs have archers among their troops. Despite their effectiveness, they are perceived as cowards and are generally second rank warriors.
Berserkers are crazed warriors who ignore all danger while in their battle trance. Fast and violent, they don't feel pain or fear.
Chieftains are the stronger orcs who have survived battles and challenges from other orcs to seize a position of power.
Orcs are brutish, tribal warriors, known for their barbaric habits. They live by raiding and looting.
The closest thing the orcs have to a cleric, with some mystical powers.
A monstrous spider able to travel freely to and from the ethereal plane.
An evil priest leads a religious sect conducting depraved rites in the shadows of respectable society.
Scouts are skilled hunters and trackers who offer their services for a fee.
Skeletons are animated by dark magic. They used to be living creatures but are now empty shells of hate, arisen from tombs or battlefields and craving for life… to kill.
Skeletons are animated by dark magic. They used to be living creatures but are now empty shells of hate, arisen from tombs or battlefields and craving for life… to kill.
A powerful undead creature armed with an axe and a shield.
A powerful undead creature, created by raising a dead knight.
A powerful undead creature with necromantic powers.
A very large type of Sorr-Akkath, much stronger and deadlier than its smaller comrades, and apparently less intelligent.
These spellcasters seem to be clerics of Sorr-Tarr.
A powerful armored fighter, with superior resistances and magical abilities.
A deadly killer who lurks in the shadows.
A basic Sorr-Akkath fighter, aggressive and ruthless.
A support fighter, fast, cunning, and vicious.
Dead Badlands spiders somehow transformed into undead.
Larger than your usual house spider, this creature is quite dangerous.
A lawless rogue trained to spy and kill for wealthy masters.
Thugs are ruthless enforcers skilled at intimidation and violence. They work for money and have few scruples.
A large flying snake with terrible poison in its fangs.
An adult wolf, looking particularly aggressive.
A wandering wolf, looking skinny and weak, but famished.

Veterans are professional fighters who take up arms for pay or in defense of something they value or believe in. They include retired soldiers as well as mercenaries who have never served anyone's interests but their own.
A large arctic wolf with a cold breath attack.
A typical wild beast from Solasta's grasslands and forests.
A human working in the Badlands, of unknown affiliation.
A ravenous undead creature, constantly searching for flesh to eat.
A shapechanger in human form, he retains some of his unnatural powers, including a fantastic resistance to non-silvered weapons.
One of Arrok's pawns, this orc has been blessed with the power of fire.
An elusive orc, less confrontational than most, who uses his tamed beasts to fight for him.
A veteran goblin who became a skilled killer.
This veteran mercenary seems inhabited by a fanatic fury.
This Darkweaver seems inhabited by a fanatic fury.
A gigantic spider that must have lived centuries in the dark.
A bat-shaped fire elemental, only encountered in the depths of the Badlands.
A powerful skeleton archer that shoots magical arrows imbued with necrotic magic.
An incorporeal undead that can drain your life and hates light.
A small fire elemental that likes to burn stuff.
A sneaky orc trained to use the shadows to stab its enemies in the back.
A giant spider from the underground acid lakes of the Badlands.
A flying current of whirling air animated by magical elemental forces.
A creature of pure fire, animated by magical elemental forces.
A bulky stone creature animated by magical elemental forces.
A small air elemental that can freeze you to death.
A small earth elemental made of skarn rock that can slam your feet until they hurt.
A large insect that is a member of the Redeemer species, its bite is acidic and it can spray pheromones that trigger a frenzy among its ranks.
A very large insect that is a member of the Redeemer species, with a capacity to attack with electric shocks.
A weird creature of light and magic of unknown origin.
This dragon seems to be the master of conjuration of the old Imperial Arcaneum!
A monstrous insect capable of swallowing an adventurer whole!
The leader of the Soraks on Solasta, an ancient and powerful Acolyte of Sorr-Tarr.
A powerful creature sent by a deity to support a believer in need.
It looks like this Black Dragon is actually Mardracht, the Master of Necromancy of the Manacalon Arcaneum!
Offspring of the Old Queen. She loves them so much that she eats them once in a while.
The offspring of the apex predator are terrifying little monsters.
A smaller dragon, degenerated by the chaotic magic of the badlands.
A smaller dragon, degenerated by the chaotic magic of the badlands.
It looks like this Gold Dragon is actually Adrasteia, the Master of Abjuration of the Manacalon Arcaneum!
A savage beast, commonly met everywhere in the known world.
A dangerous beast, commonly encounted in caves and forests.
A monstruous lycanthrope turned into a huge bear, almost impossible to hurt.
Another beast that was horribly mutated by the magic of the Badlands over generations, and resulted in a monstrosity.
This Badlands Bear has been intentionally modified with magic, making it more brutal and dangerous than it used to be.
A large, powerful ape, typical of the jungles of the old Empire.
Among the powerful Minotaur, some arise as superior fighters and get extra training, enough to master deadly skills and even more strength and power than their brothers.
Such dreadful creatures can only be created by twisted necromancers, who wish to prolong a Minotaur's slavery indefinitely, in death.
Made of ice and snow, their heart is also cold. These creatures live for battle and mayhem.
Born in the fires of the volcanos under the Badlands, trained to fight and forge, these huge creatures are alas generally hostile.
Immense creatures born of the very earth of Solasta, they dwell in gigantic caves and never feel at home under the sky.
Stupid and voracious, these creatures are in constant search of food, and that may very well mean you and your friends.
Trolls regenerate 10HP per round unless damage by acid.
A huge insect from the Badlands. It might have been an ancestor of the dreadful Redeemers.
